physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Roughly 1 cm pigmented macule on left cheek diagnosed as lentigo maligna.
3.0 x 2.5 cm tan to brown macule with irregular borders diagnosed as lentigo maligna.
Area of hypopigmentation started to form in the center of the lesion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Lesion gradually tripled in size over the next decade with no suspicious areas for invasive melanoma.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Erythema and hypopigmentation biopsied, revealing lentigo maligna.
Erythematous scaly areas lateral to the skin graft with keratinocytic atypia consistent with actinic keratosis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The lesion persisted despite treatment and biopsies did not meet criteria for diagnosis of lentigo maligna.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Erythema traversing the lateral edge of the skin graft showed lentigo maligna with possible early invasion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: This progressed to a diagnosis of lentigo maligna melanoma (Breslow thickness 0.2 mm, Clark level II).

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Yellow plaque at the junction between the two previous skin grafts diagnosed as lentigo maligna arising in a seborrheic keratosis.
